issues.description: The problem statement (and the example Main in the template) specify a static method named acceptSupplyDelivery(String, int, int) on SealSaloon, but the solution implementation defines a static method named receiveDelivery(String, int, int) instead. This name/signature mismatch between the spec/examples and the solution is likely to confuse students (and will make example code or tests that call acceptSupplyDelivery fail to compile/run against the provided solution).
issues.suggested_fix: Align the method name between spec/examples and implementation. Rename the solution's receiveDelivery(String, int, int) method to acceptSupplyDelivery(String, int, int) (keeping it static and preserving parameters/behavior), and update any references (e.g., commented examples in Main) accordingly. Alternatively, if receiveDelivery is preferred, update the problem statement and template examples to refer to receiveDelivery instead — but ensure the name is consistent across all artifacts.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML and textual description) requires a static method named acceptSupplyDelivery(String, int, int) on SealSaloon to handle incoming ingredient deliveries. The reference solution instead implements this functionality under the different identifier receiveDelivery(String, int, int). This inconsistent naming for the same conceptual operation (accepting a supply delivery and updating shared stock) can confuse students when mapping the problem requirements and UML to the provided reference implementation or tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Use a single consistent name for the delivery method across artifacts. Rename the solution method receiveDelivery(String name, int price, int quantity) to acceptSupplyDelivery(String name, int price, int quantity) (or update the problem/UML to refer to receiveDelivery) so that the method name in the reference solution exactly matches the name specified in the problem statement and UML.
